name: Relais Hotel Centrale

reviews.title: Reservation Problems
reviews.text: I knew, but never really understood how much we, as travelers, are at the mercy of hotels. This is especially true the further in distance and culture we travel. A regrettable and avoidable incident at Florence’s Centrale Hotel illustrates the point and will hopefully allow you to make a fully informed choice about staying there.

My wife and I arrived at the Centrale about 4 PM--with a copy of our confirmed email reservations in hand--on 17 May 2007. Margarita, (The name may be misspelled but is some derivative of the preceding.) who claims to be the owner, greeted us with the news that, Yes, we had reservations for the period 17 through 23 May. However, she said, the guests in “your room” had inexplicably not checked out. The Centrale’s hands were tied, she said, there was nothing the hotel could do. However, we were now booked us at an “equivalent” hotel for the night. She continued, without a break, apparently thinking this tactic would forestall a protest, with directions to this alternate hotel.
reviews.title: A Fantastic Choice!

reviews.text: We were finally able to squeeze a word in and asked rather bluntly why the other guests had not check out. She said she didn’t know. We suggested the hotel pack the other guest’s bags and stack them in the hallway—we, after all, had reservations. Nope, can’t do that. Okay, pack their bags and send them to this equivalent hotel; we were playing by the rules, the other guests were not. Nope, can’t do that either. We could either accept the alternate booking—-same price, she claimed--or find other accommodations in already booked-up Florence.
reviews.title: Wonderful gem

reviews.text: So, this was our first instance of “at the mercy of the hotel.” Rather unhappily and wearily, we trudged to the other hotel. The room was adequate, but not in the same category as the Centrale, and certainly not worth what we paid. Unfortunately, the story doesn’t end, here. We returned and were placed—not at our request--into a better grade room than we originally reserved—-for two nights.
reviews.title: Mixed Sadly

likes.liked: — Location and the quiet from a noisy city
likes.disliked: — Things didn't work and services that were promised were not delivered

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: On the third day, Margarita again stopped me to advise, not ask, mind you, but direct, that we had to repack and move to still another room because other guests who “really want that room”—i.e. are going to pay the additional 70 Euro for it—are due in and we have to move. So, we again worked through the litany of what’s fair and why we again are being inconvenienced—-we never asked for the upgrade; it was probably all they had on the 18th and 19th. I’ll save you the harangue and get to the bottom line: We agreed to move and negotiated a additional 5 percent reduction in our total billing costs.
reviews.title: A little beauty

likes.liked: — location, cleanliness, sunlight and air into rooms, staff, room
likes.disliked: — small elevator but this is an issue in all small hotels in Europe

reviews.title: Health Hazard
reviews.text: My room was unhealthy cold for a human and remained cold despite several attempts by the concierge to fix the problem (though the computer). I had the electronic climate control turned all the way up but this did not make the room suitably warm for a human being. The shower room was also very cold. We were discouraged from taking showeres by the strong draft of cold air in the shower room. Still, we suffered from hypothermia and became very sick with flu and pneumonia-like symptoms. Being sick like that on the road is a bad experience. The towel rack was heated only twice a day, as was explained by the concierge, for a couple of hours in the morning and a couple of hours in the evening. It's controlled by a computer, the concierge told me. So if you want a warm towel after you take a shower, you gotta make sure you get in and out during those times. I could not figure out when it's supposed to be actually warm. Needless to say I am not used to a hotel mandating in such a manner when I can take a shower. The staff: they seem lackadaisical and not really customer-oriented. If the heating systems is computer controlled, still the staff has the responsibility to the guests to fix problems. They should go to the manager, the owner, etc. But if they can't fix it, they stop trying and just wait for you to leave, I guess.

reviews.title: Does what it says in the name!
reviews.text: Stayed here with my mum. We were looking for somewhere reasonable, central and safe. Hotel Centrale ticked all the boxes. Staff were so friendly and helpful. The rooms were lovely and the location was ideal.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is right in the heart of things. Looking for it initially was difficult....but what a find! Highly recommended
reviews.title: Great Hotel--Great Location

reviews.text: This hotel is a shining example of how and older property can be remodeled well.
reviews.title: Loved this hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Spacious rooms, nice bath, intenet access(additional charge for wireless). The included breakfast was well presented each morning and stocked above average for European hotels.
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel

likes.liked: — Close to attractions, clean rooms, and friendly staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: the room was clean and comfortable. this is a decent location especially to the accademia museum and train station. breakfast was modest but included and convenient. the interenet was down the entire time and the staff was not able to make any reccommendations or give much direction. they did make us dinner reservations but only to restuaurant names & addresses that we provided.
reviews.title: just average

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Lovely hotel. Air conditioning worked well, room was recently remodeled and although small, was very nicely redone and quite clean. Staff were very helpful. Conveniently located. With the window open, it was noisy but with the window closed, it was very quiet. They also provided a computer and internet access in the lobby (shared by all guests) for no charge.
reviews.title: Wonderful Hotel

likes.liked: — Nicely appointed room with air conditioning that worked.
likes.disliked: — Because of a leak, they couldn't accomodate us the first night but put us up in a nearby hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I stayed here for 4 nights in May and we loved it. The location is absolutely wonderful. You are literally less than 5 minutes from the Duomo and there are restaurants and shops close by in all directions. It is also very close to the train station and very easy to find. Our room was great. It had plenty of room, was very clean, and was very comfortable. The bathroom was great as well. It was very roomy, clean, and modern. We found the staff to be nice and helpful, but not overly so. The breakfast was very good here as well. There were pastries, bread, fruit, cereal, meats for biscuits, coffee, and multiple types of juices. We didn't leave hungry or wanting more. Florence was my favorite city in Italy and this hotel definitely aids in the fond memories. I have no complaints about Hotel Centrale and would recommend it to anyone.
reviews.title: Perfect Spot

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A great location: a short walk from the train station. and only steps away from the cathedral to the west and San Lorenzo to the north. Nearly everything you came to see in Florence is within a twenty minute walk, yet it's on a peaceful side street.
reviews.title: Couldn't hope for more at this price

reviews.text: At this price level one can't expect the spectacular, nonetheless the quite grand staircase to the second floor is impressive (there's a tiny elevator for luggage thank goodness). The lobby and common areas are modern and neat. The rooms are smallish by N.A. standards but comfortable with a stylish bathroom (shower only). Our room faced the dome of San Lorenzo... a great view to wake up to!
reviews.title: Great location!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I booked this hotel based on Rick Steve's recommendation, but in the end, it fell a little short of expectations.
reviews.title: Just OK

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The location is very good. Short walk from the train station. Definately central to all the sights and down the street from the Duomo.
reviews.title: Hotel Centrale was great

likes.liked: — Location, room size and decor, modernized but classic feel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Internet is available in the lobby and in the room if you have a laptop.
reviews.title: Our Favorite Hotel in Italy!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room was moderately clean, but the shower drain was backing up. This normally would not be too big of an issue, but the shower pan is very shallow, so even the slightest backup causes water to overflow all over the bathroom. When I notified the front desk of the issue, they said they would handle it, but in the end, it was never corrected.
reviews.title: Great location and good value

reviews.text: This place is relatively cheap so if value is the main concern, it is definately worth considering. In the end, my wife and I will most likely look for somewhere else to stay the next time we are in Florence.
reviews.title: Great hotel, great price, great location

description: Florence Center Hotel is completely restructured and renovated. Situated in the heart of Florence, Florence Center Hotel is just a few steps away from the Duomo and the principal monuments of the City, a short distance from the central Train Station S. Maria Novella, from the Fortezza Da Basso (home of the most important trade shows) and the Palazzo Dei Congressi.
